meanings.definition: To set to a starting value or condition.
meanings.sent1: I will initialize the game by pressing the start button.
meanings.sent2: Before using the new computer, you need to initialize it.
meanings.sent3: The robot refused to initialize, claiming it needed a coffee break first.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to initialize a wave of happiness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's encouraging words helped initialize a sense of confidence in the students.

meanings.sent1: Please initialize the equipment before starting the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The technician will initialize the system before the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to initialize the ingredients for the special dish in a unique way.
meanings.sent4: The team captain's speech helped initialize a sense of unity among the players.
meanings.sent5: The morning routine helped initialize a productive day ahead.
